abstract:
We present a search for an eV-scale sterile neutrino using 7.5 years of data
from the IceCube DeepCore detector. The analysis uses a sample of 21,914 events
with energies between 5 and 150 GeV to search for sterile neutrinos through
atmospheric muon neutrino disappearance. Improvements in event selection and
treatment of systematic uncertainties provide greater statistical power
compared to previous DeepCore sterile neutrino searches. Our results are
compatible with the absence of mixing between active and sterile neutrino
states, and we place constraints on the mixing matrix elements $|U_{\mu 4}|^2 <
0.0534$ and $|U_{\tau 4}|^2 < 0.0574$ at 90% CL under the assumption that
$\Delta m^2_{41}\geq 1\;\mathrm{eV^2}$. These null results add to the growing
tension between anomalous appearance results and constraints from disappearance
searches in the 3+1 sterile neutrino landscape.
